caption: Fave place in MIA!!!!

If I could give more than 5 stars I’d give it 10-10!! This place was such a wonderful and unique experience. The food was incredible, service was incredible. Overall, such a wonderful experience. Our waitress was extremely kind and helped us through the menu. Best thing we did is pick one dish out of each option. Just to make sure that we get to try everything. Must get dessert after! Sadly it was too good i even forgot to take a picture of it. Dont listen to other reviews saying bad service. We had an amazing waitress and employees were kind and always checked on us.

This food is fantastic. The mixture of Japanese and Peruvian flavors, the creativity of some of these dishes. Perfect balance and composition. The presentation, the setting, the attention of the staff. We have tried many of the offerings in the menu and they are all delicious: the rolls, the bowls, the tiraditos, the deserts!!! This is definitely our favorite restaurant in Miami.

Had a wonderful experience eating here for dinner. The food was absolutely delicious and the setting in the design district’s outdoor plaza was beautiful. The dishes were fresh, packed with flavor, and really unique, too (like the scallop and Parmesan sushi roll). I especially loved the strawberry granita and white chocolate dessert.  The service was excellent, as well. I don’t understand some of the recent reviews complaining about poor service. All of the staff we interacted with were helpful and professional. We arrived half an hour late due to traffic, and the staff was very accommodating. 5 stars all around!
You can't leave Miami before you visit this place. You just can't.
This is the best meal I’ve ever had in my entire life.. the levels of complexity in the flavors are unparalleled. This is a gem.

I want to give a shout-out and 5 stars to the hostess.  Otherwise, the service was lackluster.  The food fell flat on my palate and this felt like a bastardization of sushi. I’ve had good Peruvian-Japanese sushi but this was far from that.  The desserts were overthought and the combination of textures and flavors didn’t play well with each other.  The wine was drinkable.
Hands down best Peruvian restaurant in Miami.
Best ceviches!

One of the best dining experiences in all of Miami.  Hands down the most delicious sushi and ceviches.  Must order a tiradito and at least one of their uniquely signature banaditos like Pulpo al Olivo and Conchitas a la Parmesana.  Don't skip the exciting wine list or incredible dessert either.

After stalking their ig page for some time I finally made my way south to see if the hype was real. And, for most of the meal it sure did, but some a few odd situations and one no no. All of the staff was attentive and welcoming. A bit discombobulated as we were asked by two or three different servers what type of water we wanted and then again taking our order. A bit odd, but it’s better than being ignored. The food was pretty fantastic. The fish was extremely fresh and many a flavor explosion all over your mouth. The one major concern was that there was a small stone, presumably from the kelp in the ceviche, which I bit down on quite hard and while it is yet to be determined there appears no damage. But time will tell if there was a small fracture. I took this to the attention of two servers, and while both seemed surprised, there was not an utterance after. No apology or nothing of the sort. Which I found to be quite odd at an establishment of this caliber. One other caveat, is that they do include 20% gratuity automatically. Guessing there some cheap skates in Miami?  I don’t always look at the bill and there is no mention, so I’m glad I did in this case. Ranting aside, the food makes it worth the visit
Sushi rice is overcooked steamed long rice from Aldi.  Hire a real chef maybe ?
Food tastes like it was made by pre-schoolers playing with playdoe.  The owner adds a 20% mandatory service charge for take out orders.  Sushi was try-hard but taste meh  Don’t recommend.

This place is not worth eating because today I saw how they treated a client super badly and that leaves much to say of management, but this is saying that I will not support a place where the clientele is mistreated and lacked respect!!! #notatbullyrestaurant #notatitamae #respectclientele
Hands down best sushi in miami

There has quite simply been nobody in Miami doing more creative things than Itame. Now that they have their own place, it's even more true. Ex: the daily catch roll in a white leche de tigre covered in shaved parm and an umami-crazy wedge salad with koji dressing and caviar.

This place is a must go if you are in the Wynwood/Miami Design District Area. Attention is great, but the food was even better. The sizes are good and they serve everything very fast. The combination of Peruvian and Japanese flavors is outstanding in every dish, but My Neighbor Totoro is definitely the star of the show as it hits all the right umami, sweet, savory and tangy notes. Will definitely be back soon!
If you love Peruvian and Japanese foods, you've come to your mecca! Pictured are the Tradicional Cebiche, Tigre (vengan) and My Neighbor Totoro sushi 😍 Thanks for a great first meal in Miami!

There is a reason why the #changgang of miami has been spotlighted several times in the news. Both on and off the social media realm, I think its honest to say you've gotta try the food before you read any reviews. There seems to be a lot of bots and trolls hating on this business as of lately, my suggestion to the Changs: Disregard Trolls, Acquire Currency. Keep on shining yall, there is a reason why there is always a line at your counter. Best Regards, Andrea "fuji".

Disappointed! Came here after I read a lot of good reviews. Was looking forward to try some rolls that people talk about. Well... not quite impressed. The rice over cooked, the sushi taste “extra” fishy and does not look fresh! Place was empty and took forever to get the food. 1 roll wasn’t the one I ordered and the manager seemed annoyed when I pointed this out! Not going back.

Let me start by saying I've lived in Miami for 20 years and NEVER seen worse customer service ever! The owner’s son (Nando) needs to learn the basics of customer service in the food industry: Good interpersonal, communication skills, Problem-solving skills, and friendly service. None of these exist.... We went there on Saturday morning, ordered couple of rolls and were told it's going to take about 10 minutes. After 25 minutes I noticed a couple of customers that came after us and ordered have gotten their food. I approach the counter and said “excuse me, it's been over 20 minutes and we haven't got our food". Suddenly the manager got Agitated and started Yelling! "Do you want me to CANCEL your order!!".... I didn't believe what I heard but he kept going on and yelling at me and asking if I want a refund!? ….No, I just to know when I will be getting my food... So apparently he was insulted of me asking where my food was? I took a video of him yelling but couldn't post it here on Google (I snapped a picture of his angry face), but I will be posting this review with the video on other platforms. Doesn't matter if your food is the best You get Zero because I'm not spending my money at a place that does not respect their customers. Finally, when customers  are unhappy and post a negative review, you don’t keep attacking them. You apologize and try to rectify the situation and show other your customers that you value their business ....But Apparently you lack this basic food industry skill.
Avoid this place. Food not fresh,  and rude customer service.  five stars review here must be fake!

Not sure about all the 5 stars review and how legit they are?... The food is not that great and my pick of sushi roll was the worse. I had stomachache that evening and abdominal pain after my meal. The service is okay if you get the girl to take your older. The manager guy (Nando) is rude and lack basics of customer service. Won't recommend this place. Try the other places in the market.

Rudest service ever! After waiting 20 mins for two rolls we asked where our food was. The owner got so angry he started yelling asking if we wanted a refund when all we wanted was our food. Then he refused to give us the food that was finally ready after 25 minutes. Instead he decided to waste our food and threw it out purely out of spite. Never seen worse customer service. Manager of the market was so embarrassed for his behavior he gave us a gift card to use anywhere in the market.

Probably the most creative sushi/crudo/ceviche and poke I've ever had, including some of the more famous restaurants in Cusco, Peru. The staff is helpful and pleasant and the food is prepared fresh to order. The night before we had Totoro roll (tuna) which was just amazing. Every bite was an experience to be remembered This place deserved a return trip with 24 hrs and is on the "must go" list for any Miami traveler - will Def return !!

Probably the most creative sushi/crudo/ceviche and poke I've ever had, including some of the more famous restaurants in Cusco, Peru. The staff is helpful and pleasant and the food is prepared fresh to order. The night before we had Totoro roll (tuna) which was just amazing. Every bite was an experience to be remembered This place deserved a return trip with 24 hrs and is on the "must go" list for any Miami traveler - will Def return !!
The poke bowl I had was delicious and I saw many of the other dishes they were preparing.  Japanese Peruvian food sounds unlikely but everything really looked very beautiful.
(Translated by Google) Very good nikei sushi options  (Original) Muy buenas opciones de sushi nikei

Wow... to keep it short and sweet... we stumbled upon this place last minute and it will not be our last. My guest and I were so consumed by the food we did not even interact with each other. Both of our bowls were the best we have ever had. Don't forget to ask for the sauces and the ice tea.
Super good chefs specials. We’ll be back!

Japanese meets Peruvian! Citric, lime, seafood and all kinds yummy source. My go to in this area. All the dishes are nicely prepared with amazing flavored. Ice tea is carefully selected and the best part is that is sugar free.
Food was excellent. Quality was so fresh!  Japanese Red Snapper and Albacore was so good!

Simply amazing. Food was of great quality and taste. I followed this chef, Valerie Chan, all the way from Atlanta and I was not disappointed. I tried the salmon ceviche, a tuna tradito, and an octopus sushi roll. I was thoroughly satisfied.

I have been at Itamae for a few times already and there is no way I can be get tired of it. It’s absolutely amazing everything they do, hands downs the best place in Miami for sushi. Super recommended. Good job guys.

I'm in town to visit some friends and this is not my first visit to Miami. I'm a huge foodie...I've hunted down BBQ shack joints in little Terre Haute, IN to Michelin star restaurants in Lyon, France. Without a doubt, this place, ITAMAE, was a true gem.  I was skeptical at first...4.8 stars and 50+ reviews, but my gut said to go. It's located on the second floor of the St. Roch Market...tucked in the back left corner. To me, it seemed pretty unassuming until I walked up and saw the picture frame...ladies and gents, we have a James Beard Restaurant and Chef Awards Rising Star Chef of the Year.  With my interest further intrigued, I stood and looked at the menu...even though I had determined what I wanted before I arrived. I was talked into the Unicorn Bowl...very interesting combinations...the tart and refreshing sauce, seaweed salad with sesame and slight sweetness, and the Peruvian corn had this hint of star anise(?). It's was a winner...and the cucumber gave some bite to otherwise softer textures. Well balanced all around from flavor, to texture, to colors...beautifully plated too.  Still hungry (I don't fill up easily) I decided to order one the originals that intended on ordering...the Pulpo Al Olivo; hamachi, avocado, olive oil, octopus, bojita olive aioli, and sarza criolla. An intense olive/briny burst from the olive aioli, then the lemon/acid hits, then a hint of cilantro, then you taste the nori, and finally a little heat at the end. So much flavor in small bites...perfectly balanced so that you'll finish the entire thing.  I'm only here for three days, and I think it'll be mandatory to come back every day. The seafood was super fresh and firm in every dish. Get there early while it's still quiet...your taste buds will thank you as you'll be able to focus on the nuances of each dish. Everyone behind the counter was very kind and helpful. I can see why they hang the award proudly on their wall. I hope they continue to shine.
(Translated by Google) Highly recommended the place. The tiraditos are spectacular !!  (Original) Muy recomendado el lugar. Los tiraditos son espectaculares!!
username: José Francisco Mejía de los Reyes

caption: BEST SUSHI IN MIAMI!!! The flavor combinations, the presentation, the service, everything is AMAZING! I am very picky with my sushi and this one is by far my favorite! Acebichado is my favorite!

That sushi rolls my sister order for all of us to try on the table were fantastic. The rice was cooked to perfection and the presentation was super nice.  I couldn't eat the octopus one because of my allergies but they all loved it, they even said it was one of the best they tried.  This restaurant in one of the many small and cute places at the St. Roche Market at the Miami Design District.  I love to come in here and I can not wait to go and try the other things o their menu.

(Translated by Google) Excellent place to choose the food you want. And at a good price. But the best is the food !!!  (Original) Excelente sitio para escoger la comida que se desea. Y a buen  precio. Pero lo mejor es la comida!!!
(Translated by Google) Sushi as not seen in Brazil!  (Original) Sushi como não visto no Brasil!
(Translated by Google) Beautiful place  (Original) Lugar bonito

Offering very delicious new style Japanese cuisine make by the friendly chef! I and my wife had a chance to have a dinner at ITAMAE when we visit Miami, and we both agree to give a five-star to the small restaurant and the young chef!
Thick cuts of fresh tuna, yellowtail and salmon made my day.  Highly recommend.
The best poke I have had
Healthy and delish, realized in this little gem inside St Roch.
Awesome rolls! Fresh, innovative and delicious! My new favorite restaurant at Roch St Market! Great service!
The best sushi I tried in my life! I will definitely recommend to drive here in try TOTORO TUNA
I eat out the most fine dining but there food is the the top koch!!!! Peruvian with Japanese cuisine!!!!!!@
this has to be the best sushi menu EVER everything so precise so delicious so much love put into pleasing our stomachs and our hearts
Spectacular  food...

I had lunch here and the sushi was on point. Given it was a late lunch, it was quiet, but I bet it can get high volume during lunch and dinner. The service was friendly and quick. Great location, great food, great service. I would come here again.
Never ever had an experience like that. Wonderful. Fabulous! Highly recommended. Healthy fresh.
(Translated by Google) I loved  (Original) Adorei

This family owned Peruvian Cuisine is absolutely amazing. Everyone is so friendly and it’s just so cute how the father and children work together. Extremely talented chefs creating top of the line Peruvian cuisine. The tiraditos are another level delish and you must try their specials. This purple sauce was nothing like I have ever tried before and I’m drooling just thinking about it!! 🤤🤤🤤
Good
Great food!

If you have taste buds, treat them to this delicious delicacy! It's the perfect combination of Peruvian and Japanese cuisine; bringing to the table a colorful spectrum of tastes. This place is hands down the best sushi and ceviche place in all of Miami! 10/5
Amazing
Greatest family of chefs that know how to mix ingredients to make incredible flavours!
This that good good, make ya eyes watery after you take a hit type ish.
Fresh and delicious👍🏽 Totoro Roll👍🏽
Excellent quality and service from the Chang Gang
Great food and service. The vegan oro rolls were delicious!
Amaziiiiingggg!!!! Sushi bowls and tiraditos are incredible! Good quality and flavors!
You really have to try this place if you like good cebiche and Peruvian food fusion.

This is the Miami spot I consistently crave. There’s no mistaking the excellence, care and creativity of “The Chang Gang” as they create Peruvian sushi that is fresh, dynamic and delicious. I love supporting a family business where the father, son and daughter are all consummate professionals and good souls. And the food is spectacular!!! I lived in Lima, Peru and I’ve eaten a lot of Peruvian food since that reminds me of Peru, but these flavors make me think I’m there. There are even vegan options that are remarkable. You can’t go wrong with any of the rolls, but the daily tiraditos and bowls are my go-to favorites.
Try the Chiclayo bowl - it’s amazing!
Two words: Kyoto Bowl. As a vegan, a true delicacy.
